Issues.Title: refactor(core): Handle corrupted text nodes during serialization and hydration process
Issues.Body:
This PR handles two cases:
- Restoring empty text nodes that were lost during serialization
- Preserving text nodes in the case that a text node is immediately adjacent to another text node

Both are cases in which information about those nodes / separators being present is lost when serialized and transferred to the browser. We handle this with special comment nodes that are added just prior to SSR DOM serialization. Those comment nodes are found and replaced with their respective empty text nodes or separations during the hydration process.

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(core): Handle corrupted text nodes during serialization and hydration process" (#49419)

Issues.Title: Formcontrol got dereferenced after parent form passed to child component
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

forms

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

I've set up the test case here https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-8q1ikv?file=src/app/form-field-label-example.ts

I attempted to setControl on a form control and the control stopped updating after this. It seems calling setControl dereference the form control (not updating anymore in parent component) when passing the parent form reference to the child component. However, tested the same for formarray, it works fine, it seems this only happens for formcontrols directly under parent form.



### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-8q1ikv?file=src/app/form-field-label-example.ts

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
FormControl stopped updating after 2 seconds, you can see that when selecting different options of the radio button.
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular 15.2.2
```


### Anything else?

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Formcontrol got dereferenced after parent form passed to child component" (#49418)

Issues.Title: Missing Bazel Documentation
Issues.Body:
### Describe the problem that you experienced

[@angular/bazel](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@angular/bazel) does not appear to be documented on angular.io, the closest I've found is [a mention about the builder's deprecation](https://angular.io/guide/deprecations#bazel-builder-and-schematics).

I believe it would be helpful to share the use and purpose or at least the status of this package. It seems it [may be deprecated](https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/37190) which seems accurate according to [this announcement](https://dev.to/bazel/angular-bazel-leaving-angular-labs-51ja).

### Describe what you were looking for in the documentation

Information on the use of `@angular/bazel`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Missing Bazel Documentation" (#49417)

Issues.Title: [Feature Suggestion - reduce verbosity] No "relativeTo" attribute required when imperative navigation to relative path
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

_No response_

### Description

 Currently, the imperative routing logic to a relative path is as shown
         this.router.navigate(['product'],{relativeTo: this.activatedRoute})

There is no issue with this, except for verbosity.  

### Proposed solution

To cut down verbosity, I would like to suggest the optional need for relativeTo for such scenario.  When the router detects there is a prefix ./  in the url, it should take it to be relative to the current activated route.  This also have a benefit of not requiring to inject an ActivatedRoute into the component class just purely for this purpose. E.g
```
    this.router.navigate(['./product'])  <==notice the ./ prefix
```

### Alternatives considered

Create a new router api
```
this.router.relativeNavigate(['product'])  <--by default, relative to current activated route. 
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Feature Suggestion - reduce verbosity] No "relativeTo" attribute required when imperative navigation to relative path " (#49402)

Issues.Title: docs: synchronize Angular's definition in the website's main headline
Issues.Body: Today is when I noticed a discrepancy (non-compatibility) between the definition of Angular in both the website and the github repository... ðŸ˜„ - Framework (Website) Last update **Dec 10, 2022** - Platform (Github) - Last update **2 weeks ago** As someone who spent quite some time studying a little bit of pragmatics, semantics, and cognitive sciences, these two concepts trigger different lexical networks and potentially different reactions/behaviours/decisions. Thus, a significant impact on the perception of Angular, especially by early-stage adopters (both individual developers and business/legal entities). I would assume: _Platform > Framework_ Ideally, the definition should be consistent and these discrepancies should be aligned in different public facing UI(s). I suggest the short description defined for the repository as a new headline: **-"The modern web developerâ€™s platform "** or the repository's long -yet very meaningful- readme.md definition: **- "Angular is a development platform for building mobile and desktop web applications using TypeScript/JavaScript and other languages."**
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "docs: synchronize Angular's definition in the website's main headline " (#49411)

Issues.Title: feat(forms): annotated the this context with void
Issues.Body:
The typescript eslint rule 'unbound-method' currently flags any validator usage as a violation. Annotating the this context of the static functions fixes the false positive.

## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [X] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [X] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

The [typescript-eslint/unbound-method rule](https://typescript-eslint.io/rules/unbound-method/) currently flags any usage of the validators as a false positive. See [#1929](https://github.com/typescript-eslint/typescript-eslint/issues/1929) in the typescript-eslint repo. The only solutions currently are to either turn off the rule globally, ignore all static methods, or to disable the rule per file or per line.

Issue Number: N/A


## What is the new behavior?

This change simply adds an optional `this?: void` parameter to each of the Validators static methods to tell eslint that the method does not access the `this` context and therefore the rule doesn't apply. 

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [X] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information

Issues.Title: feat(platform-browser): add specific sanitization methods that return safe value types
Issues.Body:
Currently, there is no way to leverage Angular's OOB sanitization and receive a Safe type. This commit adds new sanitization methods to the DomSanitizer class that perform both sanitization and return a Safe Value.

## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [x] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
Issue Number: #[49386](https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/49386)


## What is the new behavior?
Consumers can leverage the new methods on the `DomSanitizer` to sanitize and receive a Safe Value in one step.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->


## Other information
There seems to be quite a lot of redundancy inside the DomSanitizer class., see DomSanitizer.[sanitize](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/a50ff60bff64859e4cd279a9ce0c8b47e6dfa691/packages/platform-browser/src/security/dom_sanitization_service.ts#L157). It really only sanitizes HTML and URLs, in other cases only throwing an error.
Additionally I was able to find this related issue #[40659](https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/40659).

This represents a small fix in the scheme of things. Yet it appears the sanitization requires some proper refactoring, bound to be time expensive as it is a delicate part of the framework.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(platform-browser): add specific sanitization methods that return safe value types" (#49392)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): set public class fields as properties
Issues.Body:
Configure Babel to use `setPublicClassFields: true`. As when shipping Angular packages without `"useDefineForClassFields": false` will increase the bundle size of an ng-new app by ~2Kb when `useDefineForClassFields`  is not false. due to the additional `_defineProperty`, which will be added on every class property.

See: https://babeljs.io/docs/babel-plugin-proposal-class-properties
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): set public class fields as properties" (#24849)

#### Using Bzlmod with Bazel 6:

1.  Enable with `common --enable_bzlmod` in `.bazelrc`.
2.  Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "aspect_bazel_lib", version = "1.29.2")
```

> Read more about bzlmod: <https://blog.aspect.dev/bzlmod>

#### Using WORKSPACE

Paste this snippet into your  file:

```starlark
load("@​bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")

http_archive(
    name = "aspect_bazel_lib",
    sha256 = "ee95bbc80f9ca219b93a8cc49fa19a2d4aa8649ddc9024f46abcdd33935753ca",
    strip_prefix = "bazel-lib-1.29.2",
    url = "https://github.com/aspect-build/bazel-lib/releases/download/v1.29.2/bazel-lib-v1.29.2.tar.gz",
)

load("@​aspect_bazel_lib//lib:repositories.bzl", "aspect_bazel_lib_dependencies")

aspect_bazel_lib_dependencies()

```

Optional toolchains:

```starlark

### Register the following toolchain to use jq

load("@​aspect_bazel_lib//lib:repositories.bzl", "register_jq_toolchains")

register_jq_toolchains()

### Register the following toolchain to use yq

load("@​aspect_bazel_lib//lib:repositories.bzl", "register_yq_toolchains")

register_yq_toolchains()
```

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/aspect-build/bazel-lib/compare/v1.29.1...v1.29.2

### [`v1.59.0`](https://togithub.com/sass/dart-sass/blob/HEAD/CHANGELOG.md#​1590)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/sass/dart-sass/compare/1.58.3...1.59.0)

##### Command Line Interface

-   Added a new `--fatal-deprecation` flag that lets you treat a deprecation
    warning as an error. You can pass an individual deprecation ID
    (e.g. `slash-div`) or you can pass a Dart Sass version to treat all
    deprecations initially emitted in that version or earlier as errors.

-   New `--future-deprecation` flag that lets you opt into warning for use of
    certain features that will be deprecated in the future. At the moment, the
    only option is `--future-deprecation=import`, which will emit warnings for
    Sass `@import` rules, which are not yet deprecated, but will be in the future.

##### Dart API

-   New `Deprecation` enum, which contains the different current and future
    deprecations used by the new CLI flags.

-   The `compile` methods now take in `fatalDeprecations` and `futureDeprecations`
    parameters, which work similarly to the CLI flags.

</details>

Issues.Title: CVE-2021-44906  & CVE-2022-3517 vulnerabilities found in  angular-devkit/build-angular related to wildcard package
Issues.Body:
### Command

other

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

### Intro
We are using [trivy](https://www.aquasec.com/products/trivy/) to scan vulnerable dependencies in our angular projects and we have found two critical vulnerabilities from wildcard@2.0.0 package which is part of **@angular-devkit/build-angular/15.2.2**. 
 Dependency tree is as follows

@angular-devkit/build-angular/15.2.2
>           ----- webpack-merge@5.8.0
>                     -----wildcard@2.0.0
>                              -----minimist@1.2.0
>                              -----minimatch@3.0.4

### CVE details:

1. minimist@1.2.0 
- [CVE-2021-44906  ](https://avd.aquasec.com/nvd/2021/cve-2021-44906/)
2. minimatch@3.0.4
- [CVE-2022-3517](https://avd.aquasec.com/nvd/2022/cve-2022-3517/)

### Suggestion for fix:
trivy also suggested that vulnerability is fixed in minimist@1.2.6 and  minimatch@3.0.5. since there is no recent updates in wildcard package, alternative to be found for wildcard.



### Minimal Reproduction

In any angular project with **@angular-devkit/build-angular/15.2.2**, we can run **trivy** scanner using the following command given trivy is installed in your local.

> trivy fs . --security-checks vuln --severity critical,high

reports generated on terminal will show wildcard package with two vulnerabilities with respect to minimist and minimatch

### Exception or Error

_No response_

### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI: 15.2.2
Node: 14.20.0
Package Manager: pnpm 7.17.1
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 15.2.2
... animations, cdk, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core
... forms, language-service, localize, material
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, platform-server
... router, service-worker

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1102.9
@angular-devkit/build-angular   15.2.2
@angular-devkit/core            11.2.8
@angular-devkit/schematics      11.2.8
@angular/pwa                    0.1102.8
@nguniversal/builders           15.1.0
@nguniversal/express-engine     15.1.0
@schematics/angular             11.2.8
rxjs                            6.6.7
typescript                      4.9.4
```


### Anything else relevant?

This vulnerability is observed on **@angular-devkit/build-angular/12.2.18** and above versions. Haven't verified for angular version below 12.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "CVE-2021-44906  & CVE-2022-3517 vulnerabilities found in  angular-devkit/build-angular related to wildcard package" (#24836)

### Command

build, serve, version

### Is this a regression?

14.2.0

### Description

on Linux, the `ng` command just exit with code `0` and output nothing when the command `which` is not available.
below is code from `@angular/cli/utilities/completion.js`
```javascript
/**
 * Returns whether the user has a global CLI install or `undefined` if this can't be determined.
 * Execution from `npx` is *not* considered a global CLI install.
 *
 * This does *not* mean the current execution is from a global CLI install, only that a global
 * install exists on the system.
 */
async function hasGlobalCliInstall() {
	var _a;
	// List all binaries with the `ng` name on the user's `$PATH`.
	const proc = (0, child_process_1.execFile)('which', ['-a', 'ng']);
	let stdout = '';
	(_a = proc.stdout) === null || _a === void 0 ? void 0 : _a.addListener('data', (content) => {

	});
////.... hide other codes
}
```

Issues.Title: browserslist discrepancy
Issues.Body:
### Describe the problem that you experienced

On previous Angular projects, there was a .browserslistrc file at the root automatically generated by the CLI.

New projects don't have this file anymore.
We can still generate it by using `ng generate config browserslist`.

Without that file, `npx browserslist` outputs the default browser targets (which is a different configuration).

The official documentation does not mention anything about this change.

Can you clarify what browserslist configuration new Angular projects use?

Issues.Title: feat(@angular/cli): show optional migrations during update process
Issues.Body: When running `ng update` we now display optional migrations from packages. When the terminal is interactive, we prompt the users and ask them to choose which migrations they would like to run. ``` $ ng update @angular/core --from=14 --migrate-only --allow-dirty Using package manager: yarn Collecting installed dependencies... Found 22 dependencies. ** Executing migrations of package '@angular/core' ** â–¸ Since Angular v15, the `RouterLink` contains the logic of the `RouterLinkWithHref` directive. This migration replaces all `RouterLinkWithHref` references with `RouterLink`. Migration completed (No changes made). ** Optional migrations of package '@angular/core' ** This package have 2 optional migrations that can be executed. Select the migrations that you'd like to run (Press to select, to toggle all, to invert selection, and to proceed) â¯â—¯ Update server builds to use generate ESM output. â—¯ Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. ``` In case the terminal is non interactive, we will print the commands that need to be executed to run the optional migrations. ``` $ ng update @angular/core --from=14 --migrate-only --allow-dirty Using package manager: yarn Collecting installed dependencies... Found 22 dependencies. ** Executing migrations of package '@angular/core' ** â–¸ Since Angular v15, the `RouterLink` contains the logic of the `RouterLinkWithHref` directive. This migration replaces all `RouterLinkWithHref` references with `RouterLink`. Migration completed (No changes made). ** Optional migrations of package '@angular/core' ** This package have 2 optional migrations that can be executed. â–¸ Update server builds to use generate ESM output. ng update @angular/core --migration-only --name esm-server-builds â–¸ Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. ng update @angular/core --migration-only --name migration-v15-router-link-with-href ``` **Note:** Optional migrations are defined by setting the `optional` property to `true`. Example: ```json { "schematics": { "esm-server-builds": { "version": "15.0.0", "description": "Update server builds to use generate ESM output", "factory": "./migrations/relative-link-resolution/bundle", "optional": true } } ``` Closes https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/23205 ---
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "feat(@angular/cli): show optional migrations during update process" (#24825)

Issues.Title: bug(MATERIAL): Close Scroll Strategy is triggered by scroll behavior within the overlay
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

I was working on a bug related to dropdowns moving around the screen when a scroll happens within its parent container. The proposed solution was to add a cdkScrollable directive and a 'close' Scroll Strategy to the dropdown component used.
A potential bug in Angular Material was discovered where if two nested scrollable containers exist (i.e. an overlay containing a cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport component within a scrollable window), the global scrollDispatcher would get triggered if a scroll within the dropdown occurs and this would cause the dropdown to close. Consequently, the user would never be able to scroll within the dropdown without abruptly closing it. The proposed solution for this was to inject a local scrollDispatcher instance in the overlay service, and the scroll event fired from the dropdown would not trigger the close scroll strategy.
Finally, once the dropdown is closed on outside scroll, the dropdown search field should be unfocused, and for that, .detachments() was called in the overlay service.

### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ru7qdi-tbavjg?file=src%2Fapp%2Fcdk-overlay-basic-example.html,src%2Fapp%2Fapp.module.ts,src%2Fapp%2Fcdk-overlay-basic-example.ts,src%2Fapp%2Fcdk-overlay-basic-example.css,package.json

### Expected Behavior

The local Scroll Dispatcher instance would not be needed and scrolling within the dropdown would not trigger the closing scroll strategy, since the scroll strategy is related to scroll behavior outside of the overlay and not within it (see: https://material.angular.io/cdk/overlay/overview#scroll-strategies)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/127736829/224677310-f119ff4e-5b26-4087-88c8-eec7bb65fd00.png)


### Actual Behavior

Scrolling within the dropdown overlay causes it to close.

### Environment

- Angular: 15.0.0
- CDK/Material: 15.0.0
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MATERIAL): Close Scroll Strategy is triggered by scroll behavior within the overlay" (#26780)

Issues.Title: fix(material/chips): don't prevent default mousedown action
Issues.Body:
The chip row was calling `preventDefault` on `mousedown` events in order to avoid sending focus to the chip grid which in turn moves it to the first chip. This is problematic, because preventing the default `mousedown` action also stops native drag&drop and `click` events.

These changes resolve to original issue by making the chip focusable on clicks and forwarding focus through there.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(material/chips): don't prevent default mousedown action" (#26765)

Issues.Title: fix(material/tooltip): match panel to trigger in test harness
Issues.Body:
The tooltip harness was written the assumption that only tooltip can be shown on the page at a time, however in tests that might not be the case. These changes add a couple of attributes so a trigger can be matched to its specific panel.

Fixes #26773.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/tooltip): match panel to trigger in test harness" (#26779)

Issues.Title: Material Stepper Component for Mobile (and not only that)
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

Hi everyone,

I want to ask a new feature to @angular/material package.

This feature involves steppers and changes the way headers are displayed. The default way of a @angular/material stepper is this one.
![image](https://m1.material.io/assets/0B7WCemMG6e0VOFVjMHV2TWdOMnM/components-acux-stepper-linear.png)

This is really nice for big enough screen to display. But when we go a little smaller, like on a phone screen, we encounter this problem: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/99544966/224537972-ae5b7d46-3500-4760-a064-375633d41aa3.png)

The solutions you can use are more like a workaround and less of a solution per se.
One of them is to change the display mode of the stepper from horizontal to vertical.
Another one is (a limited solution) to move the text of each item header to the bottom, but this doesn't work if you have slightly longer text or >4 steps.

The solution that i propose (that i found searching around) is this one:
![good_bad-form_steppers](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/99544966/224537674-f4a3c61d-d348-459e-8594-f4c7f1a89667.png)
Credit: https://uxmovement.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/12/good_bad-form_steppers.png (UXMOVEMENT)
By borrowing some logics from the spinner and displaying only the current step header you are set up!

If this idea is a good one, some points needs to be discussed on how to implement it in the current stepper.

### Use Case

On mobile it can be really useful to have this feature from a UX/UI standpoint. 
If you have at least 4 steps you will see that the header will be crowded of "step header item" and text will be cut. 
A possible solution for now (already offered by the package) is to move the Stepper Material mode from horizontal to vertical.

I think that this solution is still not a good one, It's a workaround.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Material Stepper Component for Mobile (and not only that)" (#26775)

Issues.Title: bug(Tooltip): Harness returns if _any_ tooltip is open
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

`MatTooltipHarness.isOpen()` returns `true` if _any_ tooltip is open. Intuitively it should returns if the tooltip _associated with that harness_ is open. The docs also sound like that's what it should do, because it uses the word "the" instead of "a":

> Gets whether the tooltip is open.

### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:
1. Have tooltips on 2 elements
2. Open one of them
3. Test `.isOpen()` on the harness for a different one

Here's a stackblitz: https://stackblitz.com/edit/harness-issue-84mcjr?file=src/app/button-harness-example.spec.ts

### Expected Behavior

`.isOpen()` would return true for the tooltip that is open, and false for the one that is not

### Actual Behavior

`.isOpen()` returns true for both

### Environment

```
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1501.2
@angular-devkit/build-angular   15.1.2
@angular-devkit/core            15.0.5
@angular-devkit/schematics      15.0.5
@angular/cdk                    15.0.3
@angular/cli                    15.0.5
@angular/fire                   7.5.0
@angular/material               15.0.3
@schematics/angular             15.0.5
rxjs                            7.5.7
typescript                      4.8.4
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(Tooltip): Harness returns if _any_ tooltip is open" (#26773)

Issues.Title: fix(material/expansion): Expansion panel content flickers during animation for lazy-loaded custom height nested expansion panels
Issues.Body:
This fix introduces workaround for a `void => collapsed` animation that is causing improper behaviour for lazy-loaded body. 
1. it disables first `void => collapsed` animation after init to disable recalculation which fixes changing heights of inner panels.
2. it sets `mat-expansion-panel-hidden` class on content init and removes it on creating lazy-loaded body to remove flicker of parent expansion panel

**BEFORE**

![chrome-capture-2023-2-11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34126556/224490870-bb0c87bf-151f-4495-9765-3c72f5a27e6c.gif)

**AFTER**

![chrome-capture-2023-2-11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/34126556/224490645-9b629e94-d349-48fc-b29c-460736816cfb.gif)

Fixes #22715
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/expansion): Expansion panel content flickers during animation for lazy-loaded custom height nested expansion panels" (#26772)

Issues.Title: fix(material/chips): styling not cleared on basic chips in listbox and grid
Issues.Body:
Fixes several issues that prevented the basic chips from appearing basic in `mat-chip-listbox` and `mat-chip-grid`:
* `basicChipAttrName` was overwritten to the correct value, but because we were checking it in the constructor, the override value wasn't picked up.
* The proper host bindings weren't in place to clear the styling.
* The user agent styles typography styles of the `button` inside the `mat-basic-chip-option` weren't cleared.
* The logic that checks if a click originates from a chip was excluding basic chips.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/chips): styling not cleared on basic chips in listbox and grid" (#26771)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-dialog): Vertical scrollbar appears but not moved on mouse wheel (for some screen resolutions)
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

_No response_

### Description

I open a modal using a MatDialog

In the `mat-dialog-content` I create as many elements as needed to display a vertical scrollbar [(reference Stackblitz)](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-tlynsx?file=src%2Fapp%2Fdialog-data-example-dialog.html).

This happens for some resolutions like this one :

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26741864/224087574-8bc79dbb-a5e8-4a2f-890f-5f157e1a62bd.png)


### Reproduction

Steps to reproduce: [StackBlitz link](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-tlynsx?file=src/app/dialog-data-example-dialog.html)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/26741864/224089484-b268a6f0-a8e3-4c99-a707-b37596fbc2de.png)



### Expected Behavior

To be able to move the scrollbar on mouse wheel

Issues.Title: build: update to TypeScript 5.0
Issues.Body: Updates the repo to TypeScript 5 and resolves some errors that came up along the way. The most notable one is that none of the Codelyzer lint rules work anymore, because they depended upon deprecated APIs that have been deleted. I decided to reimplement the rule that asserts that lifecycle hook interfaces are present, but the remaining rules didn't seem that useful so I've removed them.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: update to TypeScript 5.0" (#26755)

Issues.Title: build: remove ts-node forking bug workaround
Issues.Body:
In the past, `ts-node` had a bug that prevented forking processes when used in combination with `--esm`.

We contributed a fix upstream to `ts-node` to fix this, and this commit updates to the latest version so that we can simplify our `ng-dev` invocation. TypeStrong/ts-node@32d07e2
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: remove ts-node forking bug workaround" (#26756)

Issues.Title: Prevent step-navigation till service call in mat-stepper
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

I am using multiple steps for displaying the form. At every step, there is a  new instance of the form. I want to call a service when a user changes a form of any step and wants to navigate to any other completed step by clicking mat-stepper-headers.
The service is basically a warning dialogue which informs the user about the change and lets the user save the change if she wants to and then navigate to the selected step.

### Use Case

It would prevent the data losses which happen due to random step-navigation in cases of large data volume forms
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Prevent step-navigation till service call in mat-stepper" (#26754)
